programmes.show_description: Biographer Anthony Holden and conductor Vassily Sinaisky explore the cultural impact of Tchaikovsky's final symphony. From 2002.
Historian Anindita Ghosh explores how the printing press shaped the idea of India that was born in 1947. From 2017.
5/5. Just as Hercule Poirot looks set to solve the murder mystery, he hears disturbing news. Stars John Moffatt and George Cole.
5/6. As Harry plots against the pirate, Lord Rockingham's threat to Dona is at crisis point. Stars Lorna Heilbron.
3/6. When Elsie makes an alarming discovery, Isobel and her Mammy are called into action. Stars Eileen McCallum. From 1995.
8/8. Albert lies to Harold after breaking his porcelain. Adapted from BBC TV, with Wilfrid Brambell and Harry H Corbett. From 1971.
2/4. Romcom inspired by Katherine Whitehorn's cookery classic. Trisha meets the parents with a special pudding. Stars Eleanor Bron.
5/5. After a duet with Mickey Rooney, Susie Boyt accepts an invitation to perform at a Garland tribute show. Read by Tamsin Greig.
5/5. Vera uncovers a sinister scandal, and Irene is on her way home from Australia. Stars Patricia Routledge and Prunella Scales.
3/6. Blomps and bloops? Mrs Tiggywinkle and the M1. Frank Skinner and his guests celebrate more baffling online reviews. From 2024.
2/4. QC Robert tries to woo Elizabeth, by means of a putty-coloured carpet. Stars Hugh Bonneville and Lyndsey Marshal. From 2012.
3/3. A glorious conclusion to Dante's journey as he and Beatrice ascend through Paradise. Epic poem dramatisation. Stars John Hurt.
Two students think they've committed the perfect murder. Can anyone see through their terrible vanity? Stars Alan Rickman.
4 Extra Debut. A moment of shattering vulnerability brings a gardener and his seemingly hostile new client together. Read by Liam O'Brien.

4 Extra Debut. From Beethoven to Tchaikovsky. Actor Kenneth Williams shares his castaway music choices with Michael Parkinson. From 1987.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. Twenty years since its release, Michael Sheen reflects on his performance as Kenneth in Kenneth Williams: Fantabulosa!
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. Hancock's Half Hour writers Galton and Simpson on working with Kenneth. From 2014.
16/20. The Lad announces that he is rejecting society to go and live a truly rural life. Stars Tony Hancock. From January 1957.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. As part of Radio 4 Extra's celebration of the legendary Kenneth Williams, actress Thelma Ruby discusses sharing the stage with Kenneth in 'The Buccaneer'.
4 Extra Debut. Kenneth Williams talks to Peter Davalle about his life and career from the Caledonian Road to Round the Horne. From 1968.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. Bishop James Jones discusses Kenneth's relationship with faith.
When Jesus goes into the wilderness, he is tempted three times by the devil. Bible reading by Kenneth Williams.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. Bishop James Jones discusses Kenneth's relationship with faith.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. Broadcasting Historian Steve Arnold reveals how Kenneth came to play a secret agent version of himself in R.D. Wingfield's 'The Secret Life of Kenneth Williams'.

programmes.show_name: The Secret Life of Kenneth Williams
programmes.show_description: 4 Extra Debut. Kenneth Williams recalls another rather fantastical tale from his life as a very secret agent. With Richard Caldicot. From 1971.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. The writer and theatre critic John Lahr discusses meeting Kenneth Williams when writing his book 'Prick Up Your Ears: The Biography of Joe Orton'.
4 Extra Debut. Kenneth Williams invites countrymen Johnny Morris and Percy Edwards to explore the streets of his London. From 1980.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. Radio 4 Extra marks the 100th birthday of Kenneth Williams. Just A Minute producer Simon Brett discusses working with Kenneth on the early series.
4 Extra Debut. Nicholas Parsons chairs the devious word game. With Derek Nimmo, Peter Jones, Aimi MacDonald and Kenneth Williams.  From 1975.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. Children's TV producer Jeremy Swan discusses casting Kenneth in Jackanory.
4 Extra Debut. It's Little's birthday! Stars Kenneth Williams and Roy Kinnear. Broadcast in Radio 4's Listening Corner for young ears in 1983.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. Children's TV producer Jeremy Swan discusses working with Kenneth on Jackanory.
19/20. Kenneth Horne welcomes 'The Palone Ranger', plus bona secrets of the BBC are revealed. With Kenneth Williams. From June 1967.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. What was it like to interview Kenneth Williams? Wes Butters finds out in conversation with radio legend Ken Bruce, who spoke to Kenneth on air in the 1980s.
Inside the mind of a man sliding into madness: Kenneth Williams brings Nikolai Gogol's demented masterpiece to life. From 1991.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration. The Law Game scriptwriter Brad Ashton speaks to Wes Butters about working with Kenneth.
4 Extra Debut. Kenneth Williams, Nerys Hughes and Ian McCaskill join Shaw Taylor to give verdicts on some challenging law cases. From 1988.
...Williams: A Centenary Celebration (Omnibus). 100 years since his birth, Radio 4 Extra celebrates the legendary Kenneth Williams.
